BlendFactor.name: BlendFactor
BlendFactor.description:
The enumerated blending factors for use with WebGLBlendFunc.

These values correspond to the values required for gl.blendFunc but are not the same values.

Assuming destination with RGBA values of (Rd, Gd, Bd, Ad), and source fragment with values (Rs, Gs, Bs, As),

  • Rresult = Rs * Sr + Rd * Dr

OrbitControls.name: OrbitControls
OrbitControls.description:
OrbitControls move a camera over a sphere such that the camera up vector remains aligned with the local north vector.

For rotations, the final camera position dictates a new camera local reference frame. A rotor may be calculated that rotates the camera from its old reference frame to the new reference frame. This rotor may also be interpolated for animations.

Attribute.description: An array of attribute values associated with meta data describing how to interpret the values.

Color.name: Color
Color.description:
A mutable type representing a color through its RGB components.

WARNING: In many object-oriented designs, types representing values are completely immutable. In a graphics library where data changes rapidly and garbage collection might become an issue, it is common to use reference types, such as in this design. This mutability can lead to difficult bugs because it is hard to reason about where a color may have changed.

ContextConsumer.name: ContextConsumer
ContextConsumer.description:
This interface standardizes the concept of an implementation being dependent upon
a WebGL rendering context. The notification methods for context gain, loss, and free
allow the implementation to participate in the dynamic and volatile environment
whereupon a browser may reset its WebGL rendering contexts.

GeometryArrays.name: GeometryArrays
example:
const engine = new EIGHT.Engine()
    const geometry = new EIGHT.GeometryArrays(engine)
     geometry.drawMode = EIGHT.DrawMode.LINES
     geometry.setAttribute('aPosition', {values: [0, 0, 1, 0, 0, 0, 0, 1], size: 2})
     geometry.setAttribute('aColor', {values: [0, 1, 0, 0, 1, 0, 1, 0, 0, 1, 0, 0], size: 3})
    geometry.draw(material)
    geometry.release()

ShareableContextConsumer.name: ShareableContextConsumer
ShareableContextConsumer.description:
A base class for ContextConsumer(s).

Using this base class provides a standard and reliable way to subscribe to Engine events. Extending this class provides automatic subscribe at construction time and automatic unsubscribe in destruction. However, it does not provide automatic synchronization (contextGain events) or automatic clean up (contextFree or contextLost events) as these would violate the principle that the base class should not call derived class methods during construction or destruction.

PerspectiveCamera.name: PerspectiveCamera
PerspectiveCamera.description:
The PerspectiveCamera provides projection matrix and view matrix uniforms to the current Material.

The PerspectiveCamera plays the role of a host in the Visitor pattern. The FacetVistor will normally be a Material implementation. The accepting method is called setUniforms.
example:
const ambients: Facet[] = []

    const camera = new EIGHT.PerspectiveCamera()
    camera.aspect = canvas.clientWidth / canvas.clientHeight
    camera.eye = Geometric3.copyVector(R3.e3)
    ambients.push(camera)

    scene.draw(ambients)

The camera is initially positioned at e3

Geometric2.name: Geometric2
Geometric2.description:
A mutable multivector for the Euclidean plane with Cartesian coordinates.

The mutable nature of this class makes it suitable for high-preformance applications by avoiding temporary object creation. Danger Will Robinson! It's easy to accidentally mutate a Geometric2 quantity!
example:
// The constructor creates the zero multivector, a quantity with all components equal to zero.
    const M = new EIGHT.Geometric2()

GeometricNumber.name: GeometricNumber
GeometricNumber.description:
Which Geometric Number do I use?

Introduction

GeometricNumber is an interface used to enforce consistency of the design of various geometric numbers. But why so many implementations? To be continued...

Usage: Calculations Graphics WebGL
Design: Immutable Mutable Mutable
Euclidean Line: G1, R1 Geometric1, Vector1 Matrix2
Euclidean Plane: G2, R2 Geometric2, Vector2, Spinor2 Matrix3
Euclidean Space: G3, R3 Geometric3, Vector3, Spinor3 Matrix4

QQ.name: QQ
QQ.description: The QQ class represents a rational number, . The QQ implementation is that of an immutable (value) type. The numerator and denominator are reduced to their lowest form. Construct new instances using the static valueOf method.

R3.name: R3
R3.description:
An immutable vector in Euclidean 3D space supporting an optional unit of measure.

This class is intended to be used for Physical Science education and research by supporting linear algebra applications with units of measure.

This class is not intended to be used in high-performance graphics applications owing to the cost of creating temporary objects and unit computation.

Called to request the consumer to free any WebGL resources acquired and owned.
The consumer may assume that its cached context is still valid in order
to properly dispose of any cached resources. In the case of shared objects, this
method may be called multiple times for what is logically the same context. In such
cases the consumer must be idempotent and respond only to the first request.

This method is for use within constructors.

Immediately after a call to the super class constructor, make a call to setLoggingName. This will have the effect of refining the name used for reporting reference counts.

This method has the secondary purpose of enabling a tally of the number of classes in the constructor chain. This enables the runtime architecture to verify that destructor chains are consistent with constructor chains, which is a good practice for cleaning up resources.

Notice that this method is intentionally protected to discourage it from being called outside of the constructor.

The time standard for this Slide.

Update all currently running animations.
Essentially calls `apply` on each IAnimation in the queues of active objects.

`offset` is variable used to keep things running on schedule.
If an animation finishes before the interval, it reports the
duration `extra` that brings the tome to `now`. Subsequent animations
get a head start by considering their start time to be now - offset.
The companion to a target: IAnimationTarget containing animation state.

A map from property name to a list of properties of the property value.
It should be possible to animate many properties of a target at once.
However, a given property should only be animated in one way at a given time.
For these reasons, we structure the data as map from property name to a queue of animations.
